feature.name: Abisme
feature.origin: A Saracen lord, killed by Archbishop Turpin.

feature.name: Acelin
feature.origin: Aceline of Gascony, one of the Twelve Peers, the council of King Charles.

feature.name: Adelroth
feature.origin: Marsilion’s nephew, killed by Roland in the first battle.

feature.name: Almeric
feature.origin: One of 12 peers, killed by Marsilion.

feature.name: Anseïs
feature.origin: One of the Twelve Peers; kills Turgis; killed by Malquiant.

feature.name: Astor
feature.origin: A French baron; ruled over Valence on Rhone.

feature.name: Baligant
feature.origin: Emir of Babylon; Marsilion enlisted his help against Charlemagne.

feature.name: Basan
feature.origin: French baron; Murdered while serving as Ambassador of Marsilon.

feature.name: Basbrun
feature.origin: Charlemagne’s officer who hung Ganelon’s 30 relatives.

feature.name: Basile
feature.origin: French baron; murdered near Haltile with his brother Basan while serving as ambassador to Marsilion.

feature.name: Berenger
feature.origin: One of twelve peers; killed Estramarin; killed by Grandoyne.

feature.name: Besgun
feature.origin: Chief cook for Charlemagne's army; he guarded Ganelon after Ganelon's treachery was discovered.

feature.name: Bevon
feature.origin: A French baron; killed by Marsilion.

feature.name: Bramimond
feature.origin: Queen of Saragossa, wife of Marsilion.

feature.name: Carcassone Montes
feature.origin: Town in southern France sacked by Roland.

feature.name: Cassini Regio
feature.origin: Italian-French astronomer who discovered Iapetus in 1671, Rhea in 1672, Tethys and Dione in 1684 (1625-1712).

feature.name: Charlemagne
feature.origin: Emperor of France and Germanic nations; his forces fought the Saracens in Spain.

feature.name: Clarin
feature.origin: Saracen lord and emissary to Charles.

feature.name: Climborin
feature.origin: Saracen lord who gave his helmet to Ganelon; killed by Oliver.

feature.name: Cordova Mons
feature.origin: Town in Spain taken by Charlemagne.

feature.name: Corsablis
feature.origin: Saracen lord; volunteered to fight at Roncevaux Pass; killed Archbishop Turpin in the first battle.

feature.name: Dapamort
feature.origin: A Saracen king from Lycia; leader in Baligant’s army.

feature.name: Engelier
feature.origin: One of Twelve Peers, the Gascon of Bordeaux; the most valiant knight, killed by Climborin in the first battle.

feature.name: Escremiz
feature.origin: Escremiz of Valterne; volunteered to fight at Roncevaux Pass; killed by Engelier in the first battle.

feature.name: Eudropin
feature.origin: Saracen lord and emissary to Charles.

feature.name: Falsaron
feature.origin: Brother of King Marsilion; killed by Oliver.

feature.name: Ganelon
feature.origin: French count; stepfather of Roland; brother-in-law of Roland’s uncle Charlemagne; betrays Roland and the French rear guard to Marsilion.

feature.name: Garlon
feature.origin: Saracen lord and emissary to Charles.

feature.name: Gayne Mons
feature.origin: Spanish town whose walls Roland had shattered.

feature.name: Geboin
feature.origin: Guarded French dead; became leader of Charlemagne's 2nd column.

feature.name: Gerin
feature.origin: One of the Twelve Peers; kills Malprimis; killed by Grandoyne.

feature.name: Godefroy
feature.origin: Standard bearer of Charlemagne; brother of Tierri, Charlemagne's defender against Pinabel.

feature.name: Grandoyne
feature.origin: Son of Cappadocian King Capuel; killed Gerin, Gerier, Berenger, Guy St. Antoine, Duke Astorge; killed by Roland.

feature.name: Haltile Mons
feature.origin: Place in Spain near which Basan and Basilie were murdered by Marsilion.

feature.name: Hamon
feature.origin: Joint Commander of Charlemagne's Eighth Division.

feature.name: Ivon
feature.origin: Frankish baron, one of the Twelve Peers.

feature.name: Johun
feature.origin: Johun of Outremer; Saracen lord and emissary to Charles.

feature.name: Jurfaleu
feature.origin: Son of Marsilion, Saracen king of Spain.

feature.name: Lorant
feature.origin: French commander of one of first divisions against Baligant; killed by Baligant.

feature.name: Malprimis
feature.origin: A Saracen lord from Brigale; killed by Gerin in the first battle.

feature.name: Malun
feature.origin: A Saracen lord; killed by Oliver.

feature.name: Margaris
feature.origin: Saracen lord from Seville; volunteered to fight at Roncevaux Pass.

feature.name: Marsilion
feature.origin: Saracen king of Spain; Roland wounds him and he died of wound later.

feature.name: Matthay
feature.origin: Saracen lord and emissary to Charles.

feature.name: Milon
feature.origin: Guarded French dead while Charlemagne pursued Saracen forces.

feature.name: Naimon
feature.origin: King Charles’ wisest counselor.

feature.name: Nevelon
feature.origin: Shares command of Charlemagne’s sixth division; leader of part of the 5th column.

feature.name: Ogier
feature.origin: Dane who led 3rd column in Charlemagne's army against Baligant's forces.

feature.name: Oliver
feature.origin: Roland's friend; mortally wounded by Marganice.

feature.name: Othon
feature.origin: One of twelve peers; guarded French dead while Charlemagne pursued Saracen forces; sixth column leader.

feature.name: Pinabel
feature.origin: Pinabel of Sorence, a French baron, Ganelon's kinsmen and skilled speaker. Large and powerful, he agrees to fight Thierry to settle the issue of Ganelon's guilt and he lost the judicial combat.

feature.name: Priamon
feature.origin: Saracen lord and emissary to Charles.

feature.name: Rabel
feature.origin: A French baron; takes Roland’s place at vanguard of Charlemagne’s forces; leads first column.

feature.name: Roland
feature.origin: Charlemagne's nephew; led rear guard of French forces; hero in song of Roland.

feature.name: Roncevaux Terra
feature.origin: Pass where Roland and his forces were ambushed by the Saracens.

feature.name: Rugis
feature.origin: Saracen lord, one of the Saracen Twelve Peers.

feature.name: Samson
feature.origin: French baron, Duke of Burgundy; one of the Twelve Peers; killed by Valdebron.

feature.name: Saragossa Terra
feature.origin: Town held by Marsilion, eventually taken by the French.

feature.name: Seville Mons
feature.origin: Margaris comes from here.

feature.name: Sorence Mons
feature.origin: Castle of Pinabel.

feature.name: Thierry
feature.origin: French knight; Duke of Argonne; brother of Godefroy, Charlemagne’s standard bearer. At Ganelon's trial, Thierry alone insists on Ganelon's guilt.

feature.name: Tibbald
feature.origin: Tibbald of Reims; French baron; guarded French dead at Roncevaux.

feature.name: Timozel
feature.origin: A Saracen lord; killed by Gerin and Gerier in the first battle.

feature.name: Toledo Montes
feature.origin: Spanish town known for blacksmiths’ work; the shield of the Saracen knight Malquiant was made there.

feature.name: Torleu
feature.origin: Leader in Baligant’s army; king of Persia; killed by Rabel.

feature.name: Tortelosa Montes
feature.origin: Spanish town ruled by Count Turgis.

feature.name: Turgis
feature.origin: A Saracen baron; count of Tortelosa; killed by Oliver in the first battle.

feature.name: Turpin
feature.origin: Archbishop of Rheims in Song of Roland.

feature.name: Valdebron
feature.origin: Saracen lord, gave his sword to Ganelon.

feature.name: Valterne Mons
feature.origin: Escremiz comes from this Spanish town.
